publisher.orgName: Department of Digital Humanities, University of Graz

authority.orgName: Department of Digital Humanities, University of Graz

seriesStmt.title: GlossIT: Celtic and Latin glossing traditions: uncovering early medieval language contact and knowledge transfer
GlossIT: Keltische und lateinische Glossen als Quellen für frühmittelalterlichen Sprachkontakt und Wissenstransfer

editorialDecl.p: was über die editionsregeln und kodierungsrichtlinien

projectDesc.p: Glosses are fingerprints of the society in which texts were composed, copied, and read. Most importantly, they play a much more significant role than previous research has acknowledged and offer insights about the multilingual and multi-ethnic environment of medieval manuscript and text production the principal texts cannot: they are first-hand testimonies of the close linguistic and cultural connections between Insular Celtic (Old Breton, Old Irish, Old Welsh) and Latin speakers. GLOSSIT researches these contacts combining methods of comparative philology and historical linguistics, digital humanities (handwritten text recognition, network analysis, natural language processing), (cultural) history, and biological computation (applying DNA-sequence alignment methods to glosses).

div.ab: epdomadas septẽ & sexaginta duas fuisse cõpletas sed et partẽ iã septuagessimæ
epdomadis ĩchoatã, Et pͦ epdomadẹs inquit sexaginta duas occidet᷑ xp̃c &ñerit
eiꝰ populus qui eũ negaturus ÷ ñstatĩ pͭ lx duas epdomadas infine septua
gessimȩ epdomadis occisus est xp̃c.- quã ideo qn͠m conicere possumus segre
gauit á ceteris.- quia de hac erat plura relaturus.- Nã & xp̃c ĩ illa cruci
fixus.- & ápopulo ꝑfido ñ modo inpasione uerum continuo ex quõ iohanne
p̃dicari cæpit negatꝰ ÷.- Quod aut̃ sequit᷑ et ciuitatẽ & sc̃uariũ disipabit
populus cũduce uenturo et finis eiꝰ uastitas. & pͭ finem belli statuta de sola
tio ñad lxx epdomadas ꝑtinet. p̃dictũ ⫲ fuerat. ꝙ ipsȩ epdo mades ad xp̃i
ũs ducatũ ꝑtingerent.- Sed scriptura p̃dicto aduentu & pasione ipsius
quid &iam pͭ hanc populo quieũ reciꝑe no,let euenturũ ostendit. ducẽ eũ
uenturũ titũ dt̃ quiquadragessimo anno dominicæ pasionis. Ita cũ populo
romano ciuitatẽ & scũarium disipauit. ut ñ remaneret lapis suꝑ lapidẽ.-
Uer̃ his ꝑ anticipationẽ p̃libatis mox ad exponendũ epdomadȩ quam omi
serat redit euentũ. Confirmabit aut̃ pactũ multis epdomas una ḣ÷
ipsa nouissima in qua ł iohannes babtista ł dñs & apłi p̃dicando multos
ad fidem conuerterunt. Et in dimedio epdomadis deficiet hostia et sacri
ficiũ; dimediũ epdomadis eiꝰ quintus decimꝰ annus tiberii cesaris erat. qñdo
inchoato xp̃i babtismate hostiarũ purificatio fidelib; paulatim uilescere
